pr_title: Propagate message variables from event subprocess

timeline.message:
fix(broker): variable propagation for event subprocess

* the message variables were not propagated because they were stored as temporary variables of the scope of the event subprocess instead of its start event
* copy the temporary variable to the start event scope to apply them with the output mapping
* fix the existing message mapping test by setting the output mapping on the start event instead of the event subprocess

timeline.bodyText: Do we remove the variables from the event subprocess so the process that's inside it propagates its variables up when it's completed?
timeline.author: MiguelPires

replies.bodyText: Yes. The variables are removed from the event subprocess context because they're already merged when the start event is completed. This is also important to not use them again when the event subprocess is completed :)
